Execution of binaries signed with recent.Data: Windows Event ID 4688, Windows Event ID 3002, Windows Event ID 3004, Sysmon Event ID 1
Execution of binaries signed with recent.Action: Monitor Windows Event ID 4688 (Process Creation) and Sysmon Event ID 1 to extract signing certificate information (publisher, issuer, validity dates) for executed binaries. Correlate with Code Integrity events (Windows Event ID 3002, 3004). Identify binaries signed with certificates issued within the last X days, those not from well-known issuers, or those with unusual metadata characteristics by analyzing certificate details using descriptive statistics and frequency analysis to identify outliers.

Execution of signed binaries exhibiting.Data: Windows Event ID 4688, Sysmon Event ID 1, Sysmon Event ID 3, Zeek conn.log
Execution of signed binaries exhibiting.Action: Monitor Windows Event ID 4688 or Sysmon Event ID 1 for execution of signed binaries. Correlate these process creation events with network connection logs (Sysmon Event ID 3, Zeek conn.log) to detect suspicious outbound C2 connections. Analyze the parent-child process relationships and command lines (Windows Event ID 4688, Sysmon Event ID 1) using correlation analysis to identify signed binaries launched in unusual contexts or with suspicious parameters, or those originating from non-standard file paths.
